verses.verse: "Why aren't<WH6256> times laid up by<WH6845> the Almighty?<WH7706> Why don't<WH3045> those who know him see<WH2372> his days?<WH3117>
There are people who remove<WH5381> the landmarks.<WH1367> They violently take away<WH1497> flocks,<WH5739> and feed them.<WH7462>
They drive away<WH5090> the donkey<WH2543> of the fatherless,<WH3490> and they take<WH2254> the widow<WH490>'s ox<WH7794> for a pledge.<WH2254>
They turn<WH5186> the needy<WH34> out of the way.<WH1870> The poor<WH6041> of the earth<WH776> all<WH3162> hide themselves.<WH2244>

Behold,<WH6501> as wild donkeys in the desert,<WH4057> they go forth<WH3318> to their work,<WH6467> seeking diligently<WH7836> for food.<WH2964> The wilderness<WH6160> yields them bread<WH3899> for their children.<WH5288>
They cut<WH7114> their provender<WH1098> in the field.<WH7704> They glean<WH3953> the vineyard<WH3754> of the wicked.<WH7563>
They lie all night<WH3885> naked<WH6174> without clothing,<WH3830> and have no covering<WH3682> in the cold.<WH7135>
They are wet<WH7372> with the showers<WH2230> of the mountains,<WH2022> and embrace<WH2263> the rock<WH6697> for lack of a shelter.<WH4268>
There are those who pluck<WH1497> the fatherless<WH3490> from the breast,<WH7699> and take a pledge<WH2254> of the poor,<WH6041>
So that they go<WH1980> around naked<WH6174> without clothing.<WH3830> Being hungry,<WH7457> they carry<WH5375> the sheaves.<WH6016>
They make oil<WH6671> within<WH996> the walls<WH7791> of these men.<WH1869> They tread wine presses,<WH3342> and suffer thirst.<WH6770>
From out of the populous city,<WH5892> men<WH4962> groan.<WH5008> The soul<WH5315> of the wounded<WH2491> cries out,<WH7768> yet God<WH433> doesn't<WH7760> regard the folly.<WH8604>
"These are of those who rebel<WH4775> against the light.<WH216> They don't<WH5234> know its ways,<WH1870> nor stay<WH3427> in its paths.<WH5410>
The murderer<WH7523> rises<WH6965> with the light.<WH216> He kills<WH6991> the poor<WH6041> and needy.<WH6041> In the night<WH3915> he is like a thief.<WH1590>
The eye<WH5869> also of the adulterer<WH5003> waits<WH8104> for the twilight,<WH5399> saying,<WH559> <WH5869> 'No eye shall see<WH7789> me.<WH5643>' He disguises his face.<WH6440>
In the dark<WH2822> they dig through<WH2864> houses.<WH1004> They shut<WH2856> themselves up in the daytime.<WH3119> They don't<WH3045> know the light.<WH216>
For the morning<WH1242> is to all of them like<WH3162> thick darkness,<WH6757> for they know<WH5234> the terrors<WH1091> of the thick darkness.<WH6757>
"They are foam<WH7031> on the surface of the waters.<WH6440> Their portion<WH2513> is cursed<WH7043> in the earth.<WH776> They don't<WH6437> turn into the way<WH1870> of the vineyards.<WH3754>
Drought<WH6723> and heat<WH2527> consume<WH1497> the snow<WH7950> waters,<WH4325> so does Sheol<WH7585> those who have sinned.<WH2398>

The womb<WH7358> shall forget<WH7911> him.<WH7415> The worm shall feed sweetly<WH4988> on him.<WH2142> He shall be no more remembered. Unrighteousness<WH5766> shall be broken<WH7665> as a tree.<WH6086>
He devours<WH7462> the barren<WH6135> who don't<WH3205> bear. He shows no kindness<WH3190> to the widow.<WH490>
Yet God preserves<WH4900> the mighty<WH47> by his power.<WH3581> He rises up<WH6965> who has no assurance<WH539> of life.<WH2416>
God gives<WH5414> them security,<WH983> and they rest<WH8172> in it.<WH5869> His eyes are on their ways.<WH1870>

They are exalted;<WH7426> yet a little while,<WH4592> and they are gone.<WH4355> Yes, they are brought low, they are taken out<WH7092> of the way<WH1870> as all others,<WH5243> and are cut off as the tops<WH7218> of the ears of grain.<WH7641>
If it isn't<WH645> so now, who will prove<WH7760> me a liar,<WH3576> and make<WH7760> my speech<WH4405> worth nothing?<WH408>"
